column4: Hello folks, hope someone can help me understand why my fresh install of Ubuntu 12.04 does not boot. I just get a plain black screen after GRUB and the system seems to hang. If I start up in recovery mode I can get to a login prompt, but nothing else - running "startx" gives "Fatal server error: no screens found." Where should I start with this? Not a good sign.
not sure why it is not starting, but you might: export DISPLAY=:0 startx
sorry, you can either separate those commands or drop the word export.
lspci -nn | grep VGA
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller [0300]: Advanced Micro Devices [AMD] nee ATI M96 [Mobility Radeon HD 4650] [1002:9480]
might try installing fglrx
shouldn't I not have to do that though? This card has always been well-supported by the generic drivers (and now Nouveau, I believe)
oh right right, not Nouveau. Point being this has always worked without issue before. Since ~9.04
apt-cache policy xserver-xorg-video-radeon
Installed:  (none) Candidate: 1:6.14.99~git20111219.aacbd629-0ubuntu2 Version table: 1:6.14.99~git20111219aacbd629-0ubuntu2 0 500 http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ precise/main amd64 Packages
sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-radeon

OK...I still don't understand why I need that package though, or if I do, why it isn't included by default. Especially since I installed while connected to the Internet. To install this I'll have to connect to WiFi via commandline though - I have no idea how to do that.
well that's disappointing. I'll see if I can try to connect to wifi. Looks like it involves wpa_supplicant scripts <_<
I managed to connect to wifi, install the xorg-radeon package, and run upgrades, but the problem persists :/
apt-cache policy fglrx | grep Installed
still says Installed: (none)
tyt
sudo apt-get install libgl1-mesa-glx libgl1-mesa-dri fglrx-modaliases
OK, thanks :)
can't find the package fglrx-modaliases
there's fglrx, fglrx-amdcccle, fglrx-amdccle-updates, fglrx-dev, fglrx-updates, fglrx-updates-dev...
